title: Out of the Axis powers, which one was the closest to actually developing an atomic bomb? - Quora
tags: Atomic Bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki (August 1945)

response.answer_text: Non actually. Looking into state files the Germans had made some progress into nuclear research but had struggled to make a fully functioning reactor before the end of the war. They had made more progress into it than previously thought but were provably still a few years away from being able to produce the enriched uranium and/or plutonium fizzle material. No other axis power was even looking into nuclear as far as I'm aware.

Neither Japan nor Germany was “close.” Neither developed a sustained chain reaction; neither had calculated (as R. Peierls did in 1940) how much fissile material you needed for an atomic bomb; neither developed the production of fissile material (uranium, plutonium, etc.)
